00034 using namespace std;
00035 
00036 CelListener*
00037 QCMethod::createCelListener(ChipLayout *layout,
00038                             std::vector<string>& celFiles,
00039                             QCProbesetOptions &psOpts)
00040 {
00041   /// @todo err checking that probeset list for groupName exists and is not empty
00042 
00043   // single channel methods
00044   if (analysis == QCMethod::DM) {
00045     return createDmListener(layout, psOpts.probesetGroups[groupName], celFiles);
00046   }
00047   if (analysis == QCMethod::GENDER) {
00048     return createEmGenderCelListener(layout, psOpts.probesetGroups[groupName], celFiles);
00049   }
00050   if (analysis == QCMethod::HOMHILO) {
00051     return createHomHiLoCelListener(layout, psOpts.probesetGroups[groupName], celFiles);
00052   }
00053   if (analysis == QCMethod::ADJHOMHILO) {
00054     return createAdjHomHiLoCelListener(layout, psOpts, celFiles);
00055   }
00056 
00057   // @todo Add the rest of the methods here -- jhg
00058   // the multichannel methods.
00059   if (analysis == QCMethod::MULTICHANNEL_DISHQC) {
00060     return createMultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener(layout, psOpts.probesetGroups[groupName], psOpts);
00061     return NULL;
00062   }
00063   if (analysis == QCMethod::MULTICHANNEL_HOMHILO) {
00064     return createMultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener(layout, psOpts.probesetGroups[groupName], psOpts);
00065     return NULL;
00066   }
00067   if (analysis == QCMethod::MULTICHANNEL_SIGNALBACKGROUND) {
00068     return createSignalBackgroundCelListener(layout, psOpts.probesetGroups[groupName], psOpts);
00069   }
00070   if (analysis == QCMethod::MULTICHANNEL_VARIABILITY) {
00071     return createVariabilityScoreCelListener(layout, psOpts.probesetGroups[groupName], psOpts);
00072   }
00073 
00074   // opps!
00075   APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to create CelListener for " + ToStr(analysis));
00076 
00077   // keep g++ quiet
00078   return NULL;
00079 }
00080 
00081 /////
00082 
00083 SignalBackgroundCelListener*
00084 QCMethod::createSignalBackgroundCelListener(ChipLayout *layout,
00085                                             const vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00086                                             QCProbesetOptions &psOpts)
00087 {
00088   SignalBackgroundCelListener *sbCelListener = NULL;
00089 
00090   // SignalBackground takes a vector of ProbeLists
00091   vector<ProbeListPacked> probeSets;
00092   fillProbeListVector(probeSets, probesetNames, layout);
00093   sbCelListener = new SignalBackgroundCelListener(probeSets,psOpts,layout,analysisName);
00094 
00095   map<string, vector<bool> > masks;
00096   masks["AT"].resize(layout->getProbeCount());
00097   masks["GC"].resize(layout->getProbeCount());
00098   masks["A"].resize(layout->getProbeCount());
00099   masks["C"].resize(layout->getProbeCount());
00100   masks["G"].resize(layout->getProbeCount());
00101   masks["T"].resize(layout->getProbeCount());
00102 
00103   // Verbose::out(4, "processing probesetname: " + ToStr(probesetname));
00104   std::string probeclass;
00105   std::string ATGCclass; //A probe, G pobe, T probe or C probe?
00106   map<string, vector<bool> >::iterator maskIter;
00107   std::string ps_name;
00108 
00109   int ps_idx=0;
00110   std::string psn_name;
00111   std::string psn_ligation_base;
00112   //int line_cnt=0;
00113 
00114   // layout->m_PlFactory.dump();
00115 
00116   // @todo This is so disgusting... - jhg
00117   for(int psn_i = 0; psn_i < probesetNames.size(); psn_i++) {
00118     psn_name=probesetNames[psn_i].first;
00119     psn_ligation_base=probesetNames[psn_i].second;
00120     //
00121     //if (line_cnt++<20) {
00122     //  printf("1:createSignalBackgroundCelListener: '%s':'%s'\n",psn_name.c_str(),psn_ligation_base.c_str());
00123     //}
00124     ProbeListPacked ps = layout->getProbeListByName(psn_name);
00125     if (ps.isNull()) {
00126       continue;
00127     }
00128     //if (line_cnt++<20) {
00129     //  printf("2:createSignalBackgroundCelListener: '%s':'%s'\n",psn_name.c_str(),psn_ligation_base.c_str());
00130     ///
00131 
00132     //
00133     if ((psn_ligation_base=="A")||(psn_ligation_base=="T")) {
00134       probeclass="AT";
00135     }
00136     else {
00137       probeclass="GC";
00138     }
00139 
00140     // turn on all the masks.
00141     for (int pIx = 0; pIx<probeSets[ps_idx].probe_cnt(); pIx++) {
00142       int probeid=probeSets[ps_idx].get_probeId(pIx);
00143       masks[probeclass].at(probeid) = true;
00144       masks[psn_ligation_base].at(probeid) = true;
00145     }
00146     //
00147     ps_idx++;
00148   } // for each probelist in each probeset
00149   
00150   for(maskIter = masks.begin(); maskIter != masks.end(); maskIter++) {
00151     // count the number of probes set.
00152     int count = 0;
00153     for(vector<bool>::iterator mIx = maskIter->second.begin(); mIx != maskIter->second.end(); mIx++) {
00154       if(*mIx) {
00155         count++;
00156       }
00157     }
00158     //
00159     Verbose::out(2,"Number of " + maskIter->first + " probes is: " + ToStr(count));
00160     sbCelListener->addProbeMask(maskIter->first, maskIter->second);
00161   }
00162 
00163   Verbose::out(1, "ready to go to SignalBackgroundCelListener...");
00164 
00165   return sbCelListener;
00166 }
00167 
00168 /*

00171   masks["GC"].resize(layout->getProbeCount());

00173   masks["C"].resize(layout->getProbeCount());

00181   ATlist.push_back("T");

00183   ATlist.push_back("T_r");

00205     if (Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"AG_",1) ||
00206         Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"AC_",1) ||
00207         Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"GT_",1) ||
00208         Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"CT_",1)) {
00209       APT_ERR_ABORT("QCAnalysisOptions::CreateMultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener: "
00210                     "Found SNPs when expecting non-polymorphic probesets."

00216       // @todo This should only occur at the end.
00217       if (Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,ATlist[sIx])) {
00218         probeclass="AT";
00219         if (Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"A_f") ||
00220             Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"A_r") ||
00221             Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"A")) {
00222           ATGCclass = "A";
00223         }
00224         else {
00225           ATGCclass = "T";
00226         }
00227         break;
00228       }
00229     }
00230     
00231     // @todo should skip if above hit.
00232     for (int sIx = 0; sIx < GClist.size(); sIx++) {
00233       if (Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,GClist[sIx])) {
00234         probeclass="GC";
00235         if (Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"C_f") ||
00236             Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"C_r") ||
00237             Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"C")) {
00238           ATGCclass = "C";
00239         }
00240         else {
00241           ATGCclass = "G";
00242         }
00243         break;
00244       }
00245     }
00246     
00247     APT_ERR_ASSERT(probeclass!="","internal error");
00248     APT_ERR_ASSERT(ATGCclass!="","internal error");
00249     
00250     // turn on all the masks.
00251     for (int pIx = 0; pIx<probeSets[i].probe_cnt(); pIx++) {
00252       masks[probeclass].at(probeSets[i].get_probeId(pIx)) = true;
00253       masks[ATGCclass].at(probeSets[i].get_probeId(pIx)) = true;
00254     }
00255   } // for each probelist in each probeset
00256 
00257   for(maskIter = masks.begin(); maskIter != masks.end(); maskIter++) {
00258     int count = 0;
00259     for(vector<bool>::iterator mIx = maskIter->second.begin(); mIx != maskIter->second.end(); mIx++) {
00260       if(*mIx) {
00261         count++;
00262       }
00263     }
00264 
00265     Verbose::out(2,"Number of " + maskIter->first + " probes is: " + ToStr(count));
00266     sbCelListener->addProbeMask(maskIter->first, maskIter->second);
00267   }
00268 
00269   Verbose::out(1, "ready to go to SignalBackgroundCelListener...");
00270 
00271   return sbCelListener;
00272 }
00273 */

00276 
00277 VariabilityScoreCelListener*
00278 QCMethod::createVariabilityScoreCelListener(ChipLayout *layout,
00279                                             const vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00280                                             QCProbesetOptions &psOpts)
00281 {
00282   VariabilityScoreCelListener *VSCelListener = NULL;
00283   // SignalBackground takes a vector of Probe Lists
00284   vector<ProbeListPacked> probeSets;
00285 
00286   fillProbeListVector(probeSets, probesetNames, layout);
00287   VSCelListener = new VariabilityScoreCelListener(probeSets,psOpts,layout,analysisName);
00288   Verbose::out(1, "ready to go to VariabilityScoreCelListener...");
00289 
00290   return VSCelListener;
00291 }

00459 MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener*
00460 QCMethod::createMultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener(ChipLayout *layout,
00461                                                   const vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00462                                                   QCProbesetOptions &psOpts)
00463 {
00464   MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener *nonoverlapCelListener = NULL;
00465   // SignalBackground takes a vector of Probe Lists
00466   vector<ProbeListPacked> probeSets;
00467   fillProbeListVector(probeSets, probesetNames, layout);
00468   nonoverlapCelListener = new MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener(probeSets,psOpts,layout,analysisName);
00469 
00470   // generateMasksFromNames(nonoverlapCelListener,probeSets);
00471   // generateMasksFromChannels(nonoverlapCelListener,probeSets);
00472 
00473   map<string, vector<bool> > masks;
00474   masks["AT"].resize(probeSets.size());
00475   masks["GC"].resize(probeSets.size());
00476   
00477   map<string, vector<bool> >::iterator maskIter;
00478   
00479   std::string probeclass;
00480   std::string psn_name;
00481   std::string psn_ligation_base;
00482   
00483   int ps_i=0;
00484   for(int psn_i = 0; psn_i < probesetNames.size(); psn_i++) {
00485     psn_name=probesetNames[psn_i].first;
00486     psn_ligation_base=probesetNames[psn_i].second;
00487 
00488     ProbeListPacked ps = layout->getProbeListByName(psn_name);
00489     if (ps.isNull()) {
00490       continue;
00491     }
00492 
00493     // this has already been done.
00494     //Verbose::out(4, "processing probesetname: " + ToStr(probesetname));
00495     //if (Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"AG_",1) ||
00496     //    Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"AC_",1) ||
00497     //    Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"GT_",1) ||
00498     //    Util::endsWithStr(ps_name,"CT_",1)) {
00499     //  APT_ERR_ABORT("QCAnalysisOptions::CreateMultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener: "
00500     //                "Found SNPs when expecting non-polymorphic probesets." 
00501     //                "'"+ps_name+"'");
00502     //}
00503     
00504     if ((psn_ligation_base=="A") || (psn_ligation_base=="T")) {
00505       probeclass="AT";
00506     }
00507     else {
00508       probeclass="GC";
00509     }
00510     
00511     //
00512     masks[probeclass].at(ps_i) = true; 
00513     //
00514     ps_i++;
00515   }
00516   
00517   for (maskIter = masks.begin(); maskIter != masks.end(); maskIter++) {
00518     int count = 0;
00519     for(vector<bool>::iterator mIx = maskIter->second.begin(); mIx != maskIter->second.end(); mIx++) {
00520       if(*mIx) {
00521         count++; 
00522       }
00523     }
00524     Verbose::out(2,"Number of " + maskIter->first + " probesets is: " + ToStr(count));
00525     nonoverlapCelListener->addProbeMask(maskIter->first, maskIter->second); //mask name, and vector of bools
00526   }
00527 
00528   //
00529   Verbose::out(1, "ready to go to SignalBackgroundCelListener...");
00530   return nonoverlapCelListener;
00531 }
00532 
00533 /////
00534 
00535 MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener*
00536 QCMethod::createMultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener(ChipLayout* layout,
00537                                                const std::vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00538                                                QCProbesetOptions& psOpts)
00539 {
00540   MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener *hiLoCelListener = NULL;
00541   // Figure out options
00542   double k = 2.0f;
00543   double emThresh = 0.05f;
00544   double binSize = 0.02f;
00545 
00546   if (options.find("em.k") != options.end()) {
00547     k = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["em.k"]);
00548   }
00549   if (options.find("em.thresh") != options.end()) {
00550     emThresh = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["em.thresh"]);
00551   }
00552   if (options.find("binsize") != options.end()) {
00553     binSize = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["binsize"]);
00554   }
00555 
00556   // HomHiLoCelListener takes a vector of Probe Lists
00557   vector<ProbeListPacked> probeSets;
00558   fillProbeListVector(probeSets, probesetNames, layout);
00559   Verbose::out(1, "ready to go to MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener...");
00560   hiLoCelListener = new MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener(probeSets,psOpts,layout,k,emThresh,binSize,analysisName);
00561   return hiLoCelListener;
00562 }
00563 
00564 /////
00565 
00566 DmListener *
00567 QCMethod::createDmListener(ChipLayout *layout,
00568                            const vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00569                            const vector<string>& celFiles)
00570 {
00571   DmListener *dmListener = NULL;
00572 
00573   // Figure out options
00574   double dmCutOff = 0.33f;
00575   double dmHetMult = 1.25f;
00576   if(options.find("dm.cutoff") != options.end())
00577     dmCutOff = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["dm.cutoff"]);
00578   if(options.find("dm.hetMult") != options.end())
00579     dmHetMult = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["dm.hetMult"]);
00580 
00581   // DmListener needs a map, not a vector
00582   vector<ProbeListPacked> probesets;
00583   for(int i = 0; i < probesetNames.size(); i++) {
00584     ProbeListPacked ps = layout->getProbeListByName(probesetNames[i].first);
00585     if (!ps.isNull()) {
00586       probesets.push_back(ps);
00587     }
00588   }
00589   map<string, bool> emptyChrXSnps;
00590 
00591   // Setup thresholds to report
00592   vector<float> thresholds(2);
00593   thresholds[0] = dmCutOff;
00594   thresholds[1] = 0.33f; // for gender, we are hard coded to 0.33
00595 
00596   // Set the column label for call rate
00597   // We use a "hack" here to make the old labels in QCC file
00598   // look like the default types of labels
00599   string label;
00600   for(int i=0;i<analysisName.size(); i++) {
00601     // make lower case
00602     char c = std::tolower(analysisName[i]);
00603     // replace space and "/" with "-"
00604     if(c=='/' || c==' ')
00605       c = '-';
00606     // remove "(",")"
00607     if(c!='(' && c!=')')
00608       label.push_back(c);
00609   }
00610 
00611   // Create the listener
00612   dmListener = new DmListener(probesets, dmHetMult, celFiles.size(),
00613                               thresholds, emptyChrXSnps, label);
00614 
00615   // Set the default index for genotype calling
00616   dmListener->setDefaultCallIndex(0);
00617   // Set the default index for gender calling. Currently
00618   dmListener->setDefaultChrXCallIndex(1);
00619 
00620   return dmListener;
00621 }
00622 
00623 EmGenderCelListener*
00624 QCMethod::createEmGenderCelListener(ChipLayout* layout,
00625                                     const vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00626                                     const vector<string>& celFiles)
00627 {
00628   EmGenderCelListener *emGenderCelListener = NULL;
00629 
00630   // Figure out options
00631   double k = 4.0f;
00632   double emThresh = 0.05f;
00633   double emCutOff = 0.5f;
00634   double genderCutOff = 0.1f;
00635 
00636   if(options.find("em.k") != options.end())
00637     k = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["em.k"]);
00638   if(options.find("em.thresh") != options.end())
00639     emThresh = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["em.thresh"]);
00640   if(options.find("em.cutoff") != options.end())
00641     emCutOff = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["em.cutoff"]);
00642   if(options.find("gender.cutoff") != options.end())
00643     genderCutOff = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["gender.cutoff"]);
00644 
00645   // EmGenderCelListenertakes a vector of Probe Lists
00646   vector<ProbeListPacked> probeSets;
00647   fillProbeListVector(probeSets, probesetNames, layout);
00648 
00649   emGenderCelListener = new EmGenderCelListener(probeSets,k,emThresh,emCutOff,genderCutOff);
00650 
00651   return emGenderCelListener;
00652 }

00654 HomHiLoCelListener*
00655 QCMethod::createHomHiLoCelListener(ChipLayout *layout,
00656                                    const vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00657                                    const vector<string> &celFiles)
00658 {
00659   HomHiLoCelListener *hiLoCelListener = NULL;
00660 
00661   // Figure out options
00662   double k = 2.0f;
00663   double emThresh = 0.05f;
00664   double binSize = 0.02f;
00665   if(options.find("em.k") != options.end())
00666     k = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["em.k"]);
00667   if(options.find("em.thresh") != options.end())
00668     emThresh = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["em.thresh"]);
00669   if(options.find("binsize") != options.end())
00670     binSize = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["binsize"]);
00671 
00672   // HomHiLoCelListener takes a vector of Probe Lists
00673   vector<ProbeListPacked> probeSets;
00674   fillProbeListVector(probeSets, probesetNames, layout);
00675 
00676   hiLoCelListener = new HomHiLoCelListener(probeSets,analysisName,k,emThresh,binSize);
00677   return hiLoCelListener;
00678 }
00679 
00680 AdjHomHiLoCelListener*
00681 QCMethod::createAdjHomHiLoCelListener(ChipLayout *layout,
00682                                       QCProbesetOptions &psOpts,
00683                                       vector<string> &celFiles)
00684 {
00685   AdjHomHiLoCelListener *adjHiLoCelListener = NULL;
00686 
00687   // Figure out options
00688   double k = 2.0f;
00689   double emThresh = 0.05f;
00690   double binSize = 0.02f;
00691   double hiLoDiffCutOff = 2.0f;
00692   double hiLoFailedValue = 0.0f;
00693   if(options.find("em.k") != options.end())
00694     k = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["em.k"]);
00695   if(options.find("em.thresh") != options.end())
00696     emThresh = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["em.thresh"]);
00697   if(options.find("binsize") != options.end())
00698     binSize = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["binsize"]);
00699   if(options.find("adj.cutoff") != options.end())
00700     hiLoDiffCutOff = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["adj.cutoff"]);
00701   if(options.find("adj.failed") != options.end())
00702     hiLoFailedValue = QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(options["adj.failed"]);
00703 
00704   // AdjHomHiLoCelListener takes a vector of Probe Lists
00705   vector<ProbeListPacked> randProbesets, set1Probesets, set2Probesets;
00706   fillProbeListVector(randProbesets, psOpts.probesetGroups[options["ps.rand"]], layout);
00707   fillProbeListVector(set1Probesets, psOpts.probesetGroups[options["ps.set1"]], layout);
00708   fillProbeListVector(set2Probesets, psOpts.probesetGroups[options["ps.set2"]], layout);
00709 
00710   adjHiLoCelListener = new AdjHomHiLoCelListener(randProbesets, set1Probesets, set2Probesets,
00711                                                  options["label.rand"], options["label.set1"], options["label.set2"],
00712                                                  k, emThresh, binSize, analysisName, hiLoDiffCutOff, hiLoFailedValue);
00713 
00714   return adjHiLoCelListener;
00715 }

00719 // private method to fill in a probelist vector
00720 void QCMethod::fillProbeListVector(vector<ProbeListPacked>& probeSets,
00721                                    const vector<QCProbesetOptions::nameLigationBase_t>& probesetNames,
00722                                    ChipLayout *layout) {
00723   for(int i = 0; i < probesetNames.size(); i++) {
00724     ProbeListPacked ps = layout->getProbeListByName(probesetNames[i].first);
00725     if (!ps.isNull()) {
00726       probeSets.push_back(ps);
00727     }
00728   }
00729 }
00730 
00731 // private method to fill in a probelist vector
00732 void QCMethod::fillProbeListVector(vector<ProbeListPacked>& probeSets,
00733                                    const vector<string>& probesetNames,
00734                                    ChipLayout *layout) {
00735   for(int i = 0; i < probesetNames.size(); i++) {
00736     ProbeListPacked ps = layout->getProbeListByName(probesetNames[i]);
00737     if (!ps.isNull()) {
00738       probeSets.push_back(ps);
00739     }
00740   }
00741 }
00742 
00743 // Private utility function to convert string to float
00744 float QCAnalysisOptions::ToFloat(string valString) {
00745   string format = "%f";
00746   float val = 0.0;
00747   if(sscanf(valString.c_str(),format.c_str(),&val) == 0)
00748     Err::errAbort("Unable to convert analysis option to a number.");
00749   return val;
00750 }
00751 
00752 // Private utility function to parse options
00753 bool QCAnalysisOptions::SplitOptions(string& str,pair<string,string>& val,const char sep1,const char sep2)
00754 {
00755   int index = str.find_first_of(sep1);
00756   val.first = str.substr(0,index);
00757   int stop = str.find_first_of(sep2);
00758   if(stop == -1) {
00759     val.second = str.substr(index+1,str.length()-index);
00760 
00761     // done parsing
00762     return false;
00763   } else {
00764     val.second = str.substr(index+1,stop-index-1);
00765 
00766     // return unparsed part of string
00767     str = str.substr(stop+1,str.size()-index);
00768     return true;
00769   }
00770 
00771 }
00772 
00773 // Static method to read in a QCAFile and populate QCAnalysisOptions
00774 void QCAnalysisOptions::readQCAFile(const string &qcaFileName, QCAnalysisOptions &opts) {
00775 
00776   APT_ERR_ASSERT((qcaFileName!=""),"qcaFilename is blank.");
00777 
00778   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00779 
00780   if ((tsv.open(qcaFileName)) != affx::TSV_OK)
00781     Err::errAbort("Failed to open '" + qcaFileName);
00782 
00783   // vars to bind
00784   string analysis, analysis_name, group_name, options;
00785   tsv.bind(0, "analysis_name", &analysis_name, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00786   tsv.bind(0, "group_name",    &group_name,    affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00787   tsv.bind(0, "analysis",      &analysis,      affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00788   tsv.bind(0, "options",       &options,       affx::TSV_BIND_OPTIONAL);
00789 
00790   // get the default analysis name from the file header
00791   if(tsv.getHeader("default_analysis_name",opts.defaultAnalysisName) != affx::TSV_OK)
00792     Err::errAbort("Failed to find 'default_analysis_name' in the file header.");
00793 
00794   // get the column values for each method
00795   int rv;
00796   std::string analysis_lc;
00797   std::string analysis_name_lc;
00798 
00799   while ((rv = tsv.nextLevel(0))==affx::TSV_OK) {
00800     QCMethod method;
00801 
00802     //
00803     analysis_lc=Util::downcaseString(analysis);
00804     analysis_name_lc=Util::downcaseString(analysis_name);
00805 
00806     APT_ERR_ASSERT((analysis_name_lc!=""),"Invalid analysis name (empty)");
00807     APT_ERR_ASSERT((analysis!=""),"Invalid analysis (empty)");
00808 
00809     method.analysisName = analysis_name;
00810     method.groupName = group_name;
00811 
00812     if (analysis_lc=="dm") {
00813       method.analysis = QCMethod::DM;
00814     }
00815     else if (analysis_lc=="gender") {
00816       method.analysis = QCMethod::GENDER;
00817     }
00818     else if (analysis_lc=="homhilo") {
00819       method.analysis = QCMethod::HOMHILO;
00820     }
00821     else if (analysis_lc=="adj-homhilo") {
00822       method.analysis = QCMethod::ADJHOMHILO;
00823     }
00824     //
00825     else if ((analysis_lc=="mc-dishqc")) {
00826       method.analysis = QCMethod::MULTICHANNEL_DISHQC;
00827     }
00828     else if ((analysis_lc=="mc-homhilo")) {
00829       method.analysis = QCMethod::MULTICHANNEL_HOMHILO;
00830     }
00831     else if ((analysis_lc=="mc-signalbackground")) {
00832       method.analysis = QCMethod::MULTICHANNEL_SIGNALBACKGROUND;
00833     }
00834     else if ((analysis_lc=="mc-variability")) {
00835       method.analysis = QCMethod::MULTICHANNEL_VARIABILITY;
00836     }
00837     else {
00838       APT_ERR_ABORT("Invalid analysis requested '" + analysis_lc + "'");
00839     }
00840 
00841     if (options != "" && options != "NA") {
00842       bool stop = false;;
00843       do {
00844         pair<string,string> val;
00845         stop = SplitOptions(options,val);
00846         method.options.insert(val);
00847       } while (stop && options != "");
00848     }
00849     opts.methods.push_back(method);
00850   }
00851 
00852   if (rv != affx::TSV_OK && rv != affx::TSV_ERR_EOF && rv != affx::TSV_ERR_FILEIO) {
00853     /// @todo add line number
00854     /// @todo have tsv.getError add the file and linenumber
00855     APT_ERR_ABORT("Failed to read line: " + tsv.getError());
00856   }
00857   tsv.close();
00858 }
Generated on Wed Mar 23 2016 12:58:52 for Affymetrix Power Tools by  1.7.1
